trans-unit.source: Provides a base implementation of a channel object that exposes a dictionary interface to its properties.

<xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties> is the base class for <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelWithProperties> and <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelSinkWithProperties>.

<xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelWithProperties> and <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelSinkWithProperties> can be used as the base classes for channels and channel sinks that provide named properties.
<xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties> handles the complex task of asking a channel object for its properties.
This class makes a link demand and an inheritance demand at the class level.
A <xref:System.Security.SecurityException> is thrown when either the immediate caller or the derived class does not have infrastructure permission.
For details about security demands, see [Link Demands](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md) and [Inheritance Demands](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28b9adbb-8f08-4f10-b856-dbf59eb932d9).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties"></xref> class.
Throws a <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref>.

This method must not be implemented because it does not apply to the way <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> is being used in this case, and because <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties.IsFixedSize%2A> returns `true`.
The key that is associated with the object in the value parameter.
The value to add.
The method is called.
Throws a <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref>.

This method must not be implemented because it does not apply to the way <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> is being used in this case, and because <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties.IsFixedSize%2A> returns `true`.
The method is called.
Returns a value that indicates whether the channel object contains a property that is associated with the specified key.
The key of the property to look for.
`true` if the channel object contains a property associated with the specified key; otherwise, `false`.
Throws a <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref>.
The array to copy the properties to.
The index at which to begin copying.
The method is called.
Gets the number of properties associated with the channel object.
The number of properties associated with the channel object.
Returns a <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionaryEnumerator"></xref> that enumerates over all the properties associated with the channel object.
A <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionaryEnumerator"></xref> that enumerates over all the properties associated with the channel object.
Gets a value that indicates whether the number of properties that can be entered into the channel object is fixed.
The current implementation of <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties.IsFixedSize%2A> always returns `true`.
`true` if the number of properties that can be entered into the channel object is fixed; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the collection of properties in the channel object is read-only.
The current implementation of <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties.IsReadOnly%2A> always returns `false`.
`true` if the collection of properties in the channel object is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the dictionary of channel object properties is synchronized.
The current implementation of <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties.IsSynchronized%2A> always returns `false`.
`true` if the dictionary of channel object properties is synchronized; otherwise, `false`.
When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the property that is associated with the specified key.
The key of the property to get or set.
The property that is associated with the specified key.
The property is accessed.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of keys that the channel object properties are associated with.
A <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of keys that the channel object properties are associated with.
Gets a <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> of the channel properties associated with the channel object.
Channels properties are used to configure the channel at run time.
A <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> of the channel properties associated with the channel object.
The immediate caller does not have infrastructure permission.
Throws a <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref>.

This method must not be implemented because it does not apply to the way <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> is being used in this case, and because <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties.IsFixedSize%2A> returns `true`.
The key of the object to be removed.
The method is called.
Gets an object that is used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties"></xref>.

The current implementation of <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties.SyncRoot%2A> returns a reference to the current instance of <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties>.
An object that is used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.BaseChannelObjectWithProperties"></xref>.
Gets a <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of the values of the properties associated with the channel object.
A <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of the values of the properties associated with the channel object.
Returns a <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that enumerates over all the properties that are associated with the channel object.
A <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that enumerates over all the properties that are associated with the channel object.
